newsText: New Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) rules say astronaut hopefuls must be part of the flight crew and make contributions to space flight safety
author: Rahim Mia

newsText: Liam Ansell gets on the end of Phil Roper's shot across goal to tap home his second of the day for Great Britain and secure this key win over Canada.
author: Rahim Mia

header: Adam Peaty has been back in front of the camera
newsText: Canada will make Great Britain's men work for a second win at the Games as Floris Van Son has just fired a superb backhand finish into the net with nine minutes remaining.
author: Rahim Mia

header: What a great headline to wake up to
newsText: Dan Norton scored two tries and Dan Bibby kicked two conversions for the Rio Olympics silver medallists.
author: Rahim Mia

header: Unesco adds Madrid's Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park to heritage list
newsText: In a statement on Sunday, the Spanish government highlighted that the Paseo had been the first street of its kind to be open to all citizens - previously park-like boulevards were only open to the upper classes.
author: Rahim Mia

header: Oksana Chusovitina, 46, retires after eighth Olympics
newsText: Almost 30 years after making her Olympic debut, and having faced rivals younger than her son, Oksana Chusovitina said a tearful farewell to gymnastics on day two of the Tokyo Games.
author: Rahim Mia

header: Afghanistan curfew imposed as Taliban militants advance
newsText: The Afghan government imposed a month-long curfew across almost all of the country on Saturday in a bid to stop the Taliban from invading cities.
author: Rahim Mia

header: Prashant Kishor: How to win elections and influence people
newsText: According to his telling, he rarely watches news on TV and he doesn't read newspapers. He doesn't write emails, or take notes, and he hasn't used a laptop in a decade. The only gadget he uses is his phone, he told me. Mr Kishor has posted 86 tweets in three years, where he has half a million followers.
author: Rahim Mia

header: Nigerian outrage at brazen bandit attacks
newsText: In our series of letters from African journalists, Mannir Dan Ali, former editor-in-chief of Nigeria's Daily Trust newspaper, says the shooting down of a military jet shows how organised crime is becoming more daring by the day.
author: Rahim Mia

header: Why remote working leaves us vulnerable to cyber-attacks
newsText: REvil used Kaseya as a conduit to spread its ransomware - a malware that can scramble and steal an organisation's computer data - through other corporate and cloud-based networks that use the software.
author: Rahim Mia

header: Jurassic Pompeii' yields thousands of 'squiggly wiggly
newsText: The misfortune that struck this place 167 million years ago has delivered to him an extraordinary collection of fossil animals in what is unquestionably one of the most important Jurassic dig sites ever discovered in the UK.
author: Rahim Mia
